author: Laurence Norman
title: Europe Struggles to Respond to Covert Russian Threats
text:
BRUSSELS—The expulsion of 42 Russian diplomats from 18 European Union capitals this week sent a potent signal of Europe’s anger over the poisoning in the U.K. of a former Russian spy. But effective action to blunt Moscow’s espionage, political interference and other covert actions remain modest.

Since Moscow’s annexation of Crimea in 2014, the North Atlantic Treaty Organization has toughened their military readiness. But Europe’s response to nonmilitary pressure has been weaker as governments disagree over where the biggest...
